result.execSummary:
The defendant Angela C Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall receive Alcohol and other Drug assessment from a licensed agency as determined by Probation Agent and follow any treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angela C Anderson

records.addlTxt: Terminated - Early

For Early Discharge from Probation 
C: DOC
DOC Agent Zacharias recommending early discharge.
C: Defendant, DOC
C: Defendant, DOC
Elements

Defendant Angela C Anderson in court with attorney Jeffrey John Siewert.  
Veronica Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
State has complied with victim rights. 
Defendant questioned and advised of rights. 
16CM166 Count 1 - no contest plea. 
16CM181 Count 1 - no contest plea. 
16CM182 Count 2 - no contest plea with .141 test result. 
16CM344 Count 2 - no contest plea. 
Court accepts pleas entered and finds guilty of those counts. 
16CM181 Count 2 dismissed and read in. 
16CM182 Count 1 dismissed, Count 3 dismissed and read in. 
16CM344 Counts 1 and 3 dismissed and read in. 
Sentence recommendations by counsel. 
Court sentences as follows: 
16CM182 Count 2 - $600 fine plus costs including $42.50 blood draw fee and $50 IID surcharge. 
Bonds to be applied, with any balance returned to poster(s). 
60 days jail. 
Defendant to report today by 2:00 pm. 
Defendant granted Huber privileges. 
AODA assessment. 
24 month DL revocation effective forthwith, with credit. 
24 month IID effective forthwith. 
Defendant eligible for 2 days credit. 
Court signs half-price IID order, copy provided to the defendant. 
16CM166/16CM181/16CM344: 
Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 2 years Probation on each count running concurrent with each other. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs/supervision fees 
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations 
- submit to AODA assessment and abide by recommendations 
Court dismisses and reads in Portage County case 17CM17. 
JOC to be sent to Portage County. 
Advised of appeal rights.
